PROVISIONING_TOOLTIP_WHEN_NETWORK_IS_NOT: Device must be connected to a network to be Provisioned
DEVICE_SETUP_WIZARD_CLOSE_MESSAGE_SECOND: {{deviceName}} cannot be used until setup is complete. Progress is not saved.
POSTPONE_DFU_MESSAGE: Updates are available for your devices. These updates will take a few minutes to complete. Do not disconnect your devices during the update process.
POSTPONE_DFU_MESSAGE_SINGLE_DEVICE: An update is available for your {{deviceName}}. This update will take a few minutes to complete. Do not disconnect your device during the update process.
POSTPONE_DFU_MESSAGE_DELAY_INFO: Only {{delays}} delays are allowed before installation is auto-installed.
POSTPONE_DFU_MESSAGE_FINAL_DELAY_INFO: Only 1 delay is allowed before installation is auto-installed.
POSTPONE_APPLICATION_UPDATE: An update is available for your application.
SUCCESSFULLY_POSTPONED_DFU_ONE_HOUR_FINA: Your update for {{deviceName}} will be automatically installed in 1 hour or after reboot
SUCCESSFULLY_POSTPONED_DFU_MANY_HOURS_FI: Your update for {{deviceName}} will be automatically installed in {{hours}} hours or after reboot
SUCCESSFULLY_POSTPONED_APP_MANY_HOURS: Lens Desktop App update postponed 8 hours
PLAY_GREETING_DESCRIPTION: Select a voice file to play when answering a call.
GENERAL_MESSAGE_OPERATION_FAILED: Operation was not successfully completed. Please try again.

FTU.WELCOME_1: Let us help you get the best experience out of Poly Lens.

HP.TITLE: Manage HP cameras within Poly Lens

LOGIN_CARD.TITLE: Get Started Today!
LOGIN_CARD.DESCRIPTION: Log into Lens Desktop so Poly and your organization can provide you the best device experience.

MOUNTING.TITLE: Mounting
MOUNTING.DESCRIPTION: Position your monitor so that your eyes are level with the top third of your screen. Attach your camera to the middle of your monitor.

CENTERING.TITLE: Centering
CENTERING.DESCRIPTION: You look best when centered in your camera's view. Make sure your face is clearly visible and not cropped. Try to position yourself so others can see at least 15 cm (6 in.) of your shirt from the collar line down.

LIGHTING.TITLE: Lighting
LIGHTING.DESCRIPTION: Lighting is key to looking good on camera. Daylight is a variable light source and can conflict with interior room lighting. If possible, position your workstation so that windows are behind your monitor, and avoid strong light sources behind you. Defused overhead lighting works best.

BACKGROUND.TITLE: Background
BACKGROUND.DESCRIPTION: Background objects can make video calls more personable, but make sure that you are the main focal point. When in doubt, fewer background objects are better.

POWER.TITLE: Check the Power Switch
POWER.DESCRIPTION: Is the power switch turned on?

BLUETOOTH.TITLE: Check Your Bluetooth Adapter
BLUETOOTH.DESCRIPTION: Is there a blue light shining at the end of your adapter? Sometimes if you unplug the adapter and plug it back in, the headset connects.

MORE_APPS_OPEN.TITLE: Is more than one app using the device?
MORE_APPS_OPEN.DESCRIPTION: The device may act differently than expected if more than one app is currently using it. Try closing other apps that may be using it.

DESK.TITLE: Workstation
DESK.DESCRIPTION: Make sure the space under your workstation is clear and that you have sufficient leg room. If you can't adjust the height of your workstation, raise or lower your chair and use a footrest if necessary.

KEYBOARD.TITLE: Keyboard
KEYBOARD.DESCRIPTION: Make sure you can reach your keyboard with relaxed  shoulders with your forearms parallel to the floor.  Try to keep your wrists straight with minimal bending.

CHAIR.TITLE: Chair
CHAIR.DESCRIPTION: Choose a chair that supports your spine. Adjust the height of your chair so that your feet rest flat on the floor and your thighs are parallel to the floor. Adjust armrests so your arms gently rest on them with your shoulders relaxed.

FEET.TITLE: Feet
FEET.DESCRIPTION: Make sure you can rest your feet flat on the floor. Use a footrest if your chair is too high or if the height of your workstation requires you to raise the height of your chair.

MONITOR.TITLE: Monitor
MONITOR.DESCRIPTION: Place the monitor directly in front of you, about an arm's length away. Position the monitor 45 to 70 cm (18 to 24 in.) from your eyes, with the top of the screen at or slightly below eye level.

NETWORK_TEST.TITLE: Network Diagnostic Testing
NETWORK_TEST.NO_CONNECTION: You appear to be offline. Network testing is only available when you are connected to the internet.
NETWORK_TEST.SUBTEXT: Network diagnostic testing is a commercial preview feature.

HEADBAND.TITLE: Headband Adjustment
HEADBAND.DESCRIPTION: For a proper fit, adjust your headband so that your headset's ear cups are centered over or on your ears, and make sure the headset isn't too tight or too loose. Review the headset’s user guide for detailed adjustment instructions.

BOOM_SHAPE.TITLE: Boom Shape
BOOM_SHAPE.DESCRIPTION: Poly’s booms are bendable and easy to position. If your headset has a boom, position the microphone about 5 cm (2 in.) from your lips.

BOOM_PLACEMENT.TITLE: Boom Placement
BOOM_PLACEMENT.DESCRIPTION: If your headset has a boom, you can rotate it and wear it on either the left or right side. Make sure that when you answer a call, your boom is facing your mouth and not pointing up.

HOME.TITLE: Hello {{open_tag}}{{user_name}}{{close_tag}}
HOME.CONNECT_A_DEVICE: Connect a device to get started.

DEVICE_USAGE.TITLE: Insights
DEVICE_USAGE.DESCRIPTION: Check your device usage and workstation connectivity.

HEALTH_AND_WELLNESS.TITLE: Wellbeing
HEALTH_AND_WELLNESS.DESCRIPTION: Get reminders to hydrate and rest. Play soundscapes to improve focus.

BEST_PRACTICES.TITLE: Best Practices
BEST_PRACTICES.DESCRIPTION: Optimize your camera and learn how to make your workspace more ergonomic.

NOISEBLOCKAI.TITLE: NoiseBlockAI
NOISEBLOCKAI.DESCRIPTION: NoiseBlockAI is designed to keep non-human noises (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from impacting your meetings by listening for times when sound is occurring but no one is talking, and automatically muting your microphone. Microphone is unmuted as soon as you start speaking again.
NOISEBLOCKAI.FOR_INCOMING_DESCRIPTION: Prevent distracting sounds from the far end of the conversation (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from interrupting your meeting.
NOISEBLOCKAI.FOR_OUTGOING_DESCRIPTION: Prevent distracting sounds in your environment (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from interrupting your meeting.

SOFTWARE_UPDATE.DESCRIPTION: Software update {{build}} is available, and only {{delays}} delays are allowed before installation is auto-installed after reboot.
SOFTWARE_UPDATE.DESCRIPTION_ONE: Software update {{build}} is available, and only {{delays}} delay is allowed before installation is auto-installed after reboot.

DEVICE_UPDATE.DESCRIPTION: New Update available and only {{delays}} delays are allowed before installation is auto-installed.
DEVICE_UPDATE.DESCRIPTION_FINAL: New Update available and only 1 delay is allowed before installation is auto-installed.
DEVICE_UPDATE.UPDATE_FAILED: Update couldn't be installed at this time.

DEVICE_NOT_FOUND.TITLE: Device Not Found
DEVICE_NOT_FOUND.MESSAGE: Uh oh. There is a problem. Please try again.

PAGE_NOT_FOUND.TITLE: Page Not Found
PAGE_NOT_FOUND.MESSAGE: Uh oh. There is a problem. Please try again.

VIDEO_NOT_STARTED.MESSAGE: Poly Lens requires permissions to access your camera. To enable, grant camera access to Poly Lens in your system settings.

P21_DISPLAYLINK_OS.TITLE: Welcome to Studio P21
P21_DISPLAYLINK_OS.CONTENT: To use your Studio P21, you will need to download additional software for the display.

P21_DISPLAYLINK_TOAST.TITLE: Welcome to your new Studio P21!
P21_DISPLAYLINK_TOAST.CONTENT: Welcome to your new Studio P21! Before you can use your new device, you need to install additional software for the display

FIRST_TIME_CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION: {{deviceName}} detected. Open Poly Lens to set up this device.

QD_SCREEN_LOCK.DESCRIPTION: Your screen will lock in 5 seconds. Reconnect the headset to the inline controller to continue working.

ZOOM.ZOOM_END_MEETING: To end the current meeting, tap the call button on your headset again.

NOTIFICATIONS.CHANGE_PROVISIONING_CONFIG_FAILED: The configuration was not successfully saved.
NOTIFICATIONS.CHANGE_NTP_SETTINGS_SUCCEEDED: NTP Server Configurations were applied successfully.
NOTIFICATIONS.CHANGE_NTP_SETTINGS_FAILED: NTP Server Configurations could not be applied.
NOTIFICATIONS.SAVE_CSR_FILE_FAILED: CSR file was not successfully saved.
NOTIFICATIONS.AUDIO_DIAGNOSTIC_FAILED: Audio diagnostic failed. Please try again.
NOTIFICATIONS.WIFI_JOIN_ERROR: The network could not be joined. Please check credentials and try again.
NOTIFICATIONS.NETWORK_ERROR: Network connectivity is not available. Some features may be limited until connection is restored.

DETAIL.TITLE: Details Page
DETAIL.FAVORITE_DELETE_CONFIRM: Are you sure you want to delete the favorite "{{favoriteName}}"?
DETAIL.PREVIEW_CLICK_SHOW: Click the Show icon below to start Preview.
DETAIL.PREVIEW_WINDOWS_NOTICE: Other apps will not be able to use this camera when Preview is enabled.
DETAIL.PREVIEW_CONTROLS_READ_ERROR: Another app is using this camera.{{line_feed}}Close it to enable Preview and Settings.{{line_feed}}{{line_feed}}If that does not work, make sure the other app is not running in the background.

OVERVIEW.PROVISION_NOT_SET_UP_TOOLTIP: Device will function but will not be remotely managed
OVERVIEW.POLICY_UPDATE_NOTE: Your organization requires that this device uses a specific software version. Please update as soon as possible.
OVERVIEW.CASE_UPDATE_NOTE: Connect USB cable to update charge case
OVERVIEW.CONNECT_EARBUDS_NOTE: Connect earbuds to Lens Desktop via USB adapter to update Charge Case

MODAL.TITLE: Import Configuration
MODAL.DESCRIPTION: Enter the name and security type of the network you want to join.
MODAL.INPUT_RECOMMENDATION: We recommend naming this device after the room or meeting space it is located in.

FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.EULA_DESCRIPTION: By clicking "I Accept" below, you acknowledge and agree that your use of this software is governed by the terms of the
FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.EULA_I_ACCEPT: I accept the End User License Agreement
FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.PASSWORD_INVALID: The password you entered is invalid. Please enter the password again.

ADD_SOUNDSCAPE.TITLE: Add soundscapes to your environment
ADD_SOUNDSCAPE.DESCRIPTION: A soothing environment can help keep distractions at bay. Soundscape options include the natural sounds of waterfalls, wind, streams, forests, and oceans. These curated biophilic sounds can help reduce stress and improve focus.

DRINK.TITLE: Drink Water
DRINK.DESCRIPTION: To stay hydrated, men need about 125 ounces (3.7 liters) of water and women need about 91 ounces (2.7 liters) of water each day.
DRINK.SOURCE: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine

NOTIFICATION.TITLE: Time for a water break
NOTIFICATION.BODY: Being well-hydrated can improve sleep quality, cognition, and mood.

LOOK_AWAY.TITLE: Look Away from the screen
LOOK_AWAY.DESCRIPTION: A good rule to follow is the 20-20-20 rule, which means every 20 minutes, look at something about 20 ft (6m) away for 20 seconds.

TAKE_BREAK.TITLE: Move your body
TAKE_BREAK.DESCRIPTION: The 20-20-20 rule is a good start, but be sure to leave your workstation and get outside, stretch, or practice mindfulness.

NOTIFICATION.TITLE: Time for a break
NOTIFICATION.BODY: Taking a break can increase your attention, productivity and the quality of your work

ACOUSTIC_FENCE.TITLE: How Acoustic Fence Works
ACOUSTIC_FENCE.DESCRIPTION: Acoustic Fence uses advanced echo cancellation technology and multiple microphones to create a virtual “audio fence”. This reduces the impact that distracting sounds from outside the fence can have on your call, like your co-workers' chatter. {{line_feed}}For the best experience, use with Poly NoiseBlockAI to suppress non-speech background noise especially keyboard sounds, paper rustling, and even barking dogs.

NOISEBLOCKAI.TITLE: How NoiseBlockAI Works
NOISEBLOCKAI.DESCRIPTION: NoiseBlockAI is designed to keep non-human noises (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from impacting your meetings by using machine learning-based noise suppression techniques to reduce distracting background noises both in your environment and from the far end of the conversation. {{line_feed}}And when you aren't talking, NoiseBlockAI is automatically muting your microphone to prevent your background noises from interrupting your call.

RESTORE_DEFAULTS.TITLE: Factory Reset
RESTORE_DEFAULTS.CONFIRM_MESSAGE: This action restores all factory default settings for your device.
RESTORE_DEFAULTS.COMPLETE_MESSAGE: Remember to unplug (if USB-connected) and power off/on your headset in order for your new settings to take effect.
RESTORE_DEFAULTS.COMPLETE_MESSAGE_NO_REPLUG: In order to complete this process, your device may restart now.

RESTART_DEVICE.TITLE: Restart Device
RESTART_DEVICE.CONFIRM_MESSAGE: This action immediately restarts your device.

RESET_SETTINGS.TITLE: Factory Reset
RESET_SETTINGS.CONFIRM_MESSAGE: This action will restore all default settings for Lens.

ANTI_STARTLE.TITLE: About Anti-Startle
ANTI_STARTLE.INTRO: There are 2 or 3 options for Anti-Startle protection, depending on the product:
ANTI_STARTLE.G616_DESCRIPTION: An Australian industry guideline for acoustic shock protection that limits the audio level to your ear, reducing shock from high volumes.
ANTI_STARTLE.G616_POLY_ENHANCED_DESCRIPTION: Poly proprietary algorithms go beyond G616 protection, eliminating sudden loud sounds and instantly reducing them to ensure your listening comfort while maintaining audio integrity.
ANTI_STARTLE.OFF_DESCRIPTION: When this setting is disabled, the headset will pass audio through unfiltered, but will continue to cap sound levels at 118 dBA to protect your hearing.
ANTI_STARTLE.MORE_INFO: For more information about this feature, visit

WIFI_JOIN_NETWORK.TITLE: Find and Join a Wi-Fi Network
WIFI_JOIN_NETWORK.DESCRIPTION: Enter the name and security type of the network you want to join.

WIFI_KNOWN_NETWORKS.TITLE: Manage known networks
WIFI_KNOWN_NETWORKS.NO_NETWORKS: There are no known networks. Please connect.

CREATE_CERTIFICATE_SIGNING_REQUEST.TITLE: Create Certificate Signing Request
CREATE_CERTIFICATE_SIGNING_REQUEST.DESCRIPTION: Specify below information for your certificate request.

CERTIFICATE_DETAILS.TITLE: Certificate Details
CERTIFICATE_DETAILS.PASSWORD_ERROR: The password you entered is not valid. Please enter the password again.

LCS_DISCONNECTED.TITLE: Unable to connect to Lens Control Service
LCS_DISCONNECTED.DESCRIPTION: We'll keep trying to establish a connection. View troubleshooting tips

LCS_CONNECTION_NOT_ESTABLISHED.TITLE: Connecting to Lens Control Service
LCS_CONNECTION_NOT_ESTABLISHED.DESCRIPTION: This process may take a few seconds.

TOOLTIPS.MAKE_DEVICE_MAIN: Make this device your primary device.
TOOLTIPS.DEVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED: Device support coming soon. In-app functionality may be limited.

DFU.REPLUG_DESCRIPTION: Unplug and reconnect device, then click Continue to complete the update.
DFU.UPDATE_WARNING_1: This update takes a few minutes to complete.
DFU.UPDATE_WARNING_2: {{open_tag}}Do not disconnect your device{{close_tag}} during the update process.
DFU.UPDATE_WARNING_3: Make sure your camera is not in use by another application before proceeding with this software update.
DFU.DISTANCE_WARNING.TITLE: Get Ready to Update
DFU.DISTANCE_WARNING_1: Keep your {{open_tag}}{{device_name}}{{close_tag}} within 1.5m (5ft) of your computer during the update.
DFU.DISTANCE_WARNING_2: Disconnect any other Bluetooth connections (e.g. mobile phone) to avoid interrupting the update.
DFU.UPDATE_FAILED_TITLE: Uh oh. We have a problem.
DFU.UPDATE_FAILED_GENERAL_MESSAGE: The software update didn't successfully complete.
DFU.UPDATE_FAILED_GROUP_MESSAGE: Please check device connectivity and network connection, and retry. If you do nothing, Lens will try to perform Software Update again in 60 seconds.
DFU.UPDATE_FAILED_GROUP_MESSAGE_SUPPORT: Please try again at a later time. If problem persists, contact Support.
DFU.SOFTWARE_IS_UP_TO_DATE_TITLE: Software is already up to date
DFU.SOFTWARE_IS_UP_TO_DATE_DESCRIPTION: The device you tried to update already has the latest software.

PREREQUISITES.BatteryLowError: Your battery level is insufficient for performing an update. Charge your {{deviceName}} battery prior to updating.
PREREQUISITES.DeviceNotConnectedError: Connect your {{deviceName}} via cable to update.
PREREQUISITES.DFUInProgressError: Cannot update your {{deviceName}} while another update is in progress.
PREREQUISITES.MultipleDevicesError: Two or more devices of the same model are connected. Disconnect the other devices before updating this device.
PREREQUISITES.ReplugDevice: Unplug and reconnect device to complete the software update.
PREREQUISITES.CameraInUseError: Please make sure camera preview is disabled and microphone and camera are not active in any other application.
PREREQUISITES.SingleEarbudError: Make sure both earbuds are connected, out of the case, and at more than a 50% charge to update.
PREREQUISITES.EarbudsNotConnectedError: Connect your earbuds to proceed with update
PREREQUISITES.UpdateCaseViaUnifiedTooltip: Charge Case update available. Connect case via cable to update all devices at one time.
PREREQUISITES.UpdateCaseViaUnified: Charge Case update available. Connect case via cable to update.

DFU.UPDATE_WILL_TAKE_FEW_MINUTES: This update will take a few minutes to complete.
DFU.GROUP_DFU_WARNING_CASE_1: Make sure charge case is plugged in via cable.
DFU.GROUP_DFU_WARNING_CASE_2: Do not disconnect your charge case.
DFU.GROUP_DFU_WARNING_ADAPTER_OR_CASE: Do not disconnect your USB adapter or charge case.
DFU.GROUP_DFU_WARNING_ADAPTER: Do not disconnect your USB adapter.
DFU.GROUP_DFU_WARNING_EARBUDS: Do not put earbuds in the charge case during the update process.

0x1.name: Language
0x1.description: Select the language you want for all voice prompts and alerts. For example, "Incoming call from John." or "Mute on."
0x1.serverNotReachable: You can't change your language at this time because the server is unavailable.

Second Incoming Call.name: Second Incoming Call
Second Incoming Call.description: Control the ring behavior for an incoming call from a second communication pathway (e.g. an incoming mobile call when you are on an existing softphone call).

0x106.name: PC
0x106.description: Select the ringtone (and volume for applicable models) that you hear when your PC softphone rings.

0x107.name: Desk Phone
0x107.description: Select the ringtone (and volume for applicable models) that you hear when your deskphone rings.

0x108.name: Mobile Phone
0x108.description: Select the ringtone (and volume for applicable models) that you hear when your mobile device rings.

Ringtone.name: Ringtone
Ringtone.description: Play a ringtone that you hear when a connected device receives a call and is configured to not play its own ringtone.

Wearing Sensor.name: Wearing Sensor
Wearing Sensor.description: Turn on this master setting to allow individual configuration of all sensor-dependent settings. Turn it off to conveniently disable them all with ON one click.

Auto-Answer.name: Auto-Answer
Auto-Answer.description: Automatically answer an incoming call as you put on your headset while your phone rings.

0x202.name: Smart Audio Transfer
0x202.description: Automatically transfer call's audio from your headset to your mobile phone when you remove your headset. Put your headset on again to transfer call's audio back to the headset.

0x203.name: Call Button Lock
0x203.description: Lock the headset's call button to eliminate accidental mobile call back dialing when you are not wearing your headset.

Auto-Pause Music.name: Auto-Pause Music
Auto-Pause Music.description: Automatically pause audio streaming from a mobile device when the headset is taken off the ear (and resume when placed on the ear). Disable to play streamed audio continuously.

0x205.name: Auto-Mute
0x205.description: Automatically mute your headset's microphone when you remove your headset during a call.

Active Call Audio.name: Active Call Audio
Active Call Audio.description: Select the action you would like the headset to take when you remove it from your head during an active call.

Auto-Answer (No Sensor).name: Auto-Answer (No Sensor)
Auto-Answer (No Sensor).description: Automatically answer incoming calls when you remove your headset from the charge cradle. Set to Off to answer incoming calls when you press the call control button.

0x301.name: Auto-Connect to Mobile Phone
0x301.description: Automatically reconnect the Savi base to your mobile phone when it comes within range of the base unit.

0x302.name: Place in Cradle to Auto-Disconnect
0x302.description: Automatically disconnect a call when you place your headset in the charge cradle.

0x400.name: Default Phone Line
0x400.description: Set the outbound line your phone uses when you press the headset call control button.

Bluetooth.name: Bluetooth
Bluetooth.description: Enable to connect to your mobile device via Bluetooth.

0x402.name: Mobile Voice Commands
0x402.description: Enable to put a connected mobile device in voice command mode by pressing the mobile device button on the base.

Answering Call.name: Answering Call
Answering Call.description: Hear the voice alert "Answering Call" when you answer an incoming call via your headset.

0x913.name: Hold Reminder
0x913.description: Receive a helpful reminder that you have a call on hold.

Volume Min/Max Alerts.name: Volume Min/Max Alerts
Volume Min/Max Alerts.description: Select the type of announcement heard when volume minimum and volume maximum are reached.

Noise Exposure.name: Noise Exposure
Noise Exposure.description: Monitor and control daily noise exposure to ensure that it does not exceed the selected action value (80 dBA or 85 dBA) specified by current legislation.

Hours on Phone Per Day.name: Hours on Phone per Day
Hours on Phone Per Day.description: Optimize the accuracy of the Noise Exposure setting by selecting the value that best represents your typical use of this device.

Anti-Startle.name: Anti-Startle
Anti-Startle.description: Intelligent algorithms that eliminate acoustic shock from loud sounds, instantly reducing them to ensure your protection and listening comfort.

Answer/Ignore.name: Answer/Ignore
Answer/Ignore.description: Hear a voice prompt to "Answer" or "Ignore" a call when you receive incoming calls to your mobile phone.

Mute Reminder Mode.name: Mute Reminder Mode
Mute Reminder Mode.description: Receive a helpful reminder that your headset is muted during a call. Configure how and when teh reminder occurs.

Answering Call Alert.name: Answering Call Alert
Answering Call Alert.description: Hear the voice alert "Answering Call" when you answer an incoming call via your headset.

0x602.name: Mute Off Alert
0x602.description: The feedback you hear when you mute and unmute your headset mic.

Mute Reminder Time.name: Mute Reminder Timing
Mute Reminder Time.description: Set the number of minutes between mute reminder alerts.

0x604.name: Mute Reminder Volume
0x604.description: Set the volume for the mute reminder alert.

Mute On/Off Alerts.name: Mute On/Off Alerts
Mute On/Off Alerts.description: Select the type of alert you hear when you mute or unmute your headset microphone or receive a mute reminder.

0x608.name: System Tone
0x608.description: Set the volume for your headset's audio prompts.

Volume Level Tones.name: Volume Level Tones
Volume Level Tones.description: When adjusting the volume, hear tones indicating your current volume level.

0x60A.name: Caller ID
0x60A.description: Hear the name of the person calling.

Audio Channel Tone.name: Audio Channel Tone
Audio Channel Tone.description: Hear a short tone combination indicating that the audio channel is open and ready for communication.

0x60D.name: Mute Reminder Mode
0x60D.description: Receive a helpful reminder that your headset is muted during a call. Configure how and when the reminder occurs.

0x610.name: Mute Alerts
0x610.description: The feedback you hear when you mute and unmute your speakerphone mic.

0x700.name: Audio Quality
0x700.description: Optimize audio quality for your desired activity.

0x701.name: Over-the-Air Subscription
0x701.description: Subscribe this headset to your base without physically placing the headset in the charge cradle.

0x702.name: Range
0x702.description: Limit range to reduce audio interference from other DECT devices.

0x704.name: Streaming Audio
0x704.description: Enable to stream music, podcasts, and other types of audio from your mobile device to your headset. If you aren't streaming audio to your headset, disable this feature to help conserve battery life.

true.title: Disable Streaming Audio
true.text: Select to conserve battery power and stay on calls longer. When disabled, you can't listen to music or podcasts through your headset.

false.title: Enable Streaming Audio
false.text: Select to listen to music and podcasts through your headset. When enabled, you may reduce available talk time for calls.

Extended Range Mode (PC).name: Extended Range Mode (PC)
Extended Range Mode (PC).description: Get improved wireless range from your PC to your headset. NOTE: This will disable wideband stereo telephony and will decrease the quality of audio you hear from your PC.

0x706.name: PC Audio Bandwidth
0x706.description: Wideband audio delivers heightened speech clarity and life-like fidelity but consumes more battery power, resulting in reduced talk time.

0x707.name: Desk Phone Audio Bandwidth
0x707.description: Wideband audio delivers heightened speech clarity and life-like fidelity but consumes more battery power, resulting in reduced talk time.

HD Voice.name: HD Voice
HD Voice.description: Wideband audio enhances speech clarity if your phone and service carrier also support the feature. NOTE: This feature consumes significant battery power, resulting in reduced talk time.

narrowband.title: Disable HD Voice
narrowband.text: Wideband audio enhances speech clarity if your phone and carrier support this feature. Disable to conserve battery power and stay on calls longer.

wideband.title: Enable HD Voice
wideband.text: Wideband audio enhances speech clarity if your phone and carrier support this feature. Enabling HD Voice consumes more battery power and reduces available talk time for calls.

0x70A.name: Auto Reconnect Daisy Chain
0x70A.description: Retain daisy chain connection between two devices when they are powered on.

0x70B.name: Auto Disconnect Bluetooth
0x70B.description: Disconnect Bluetooth when device enters standby mode.

0x800.name: Increase QD Headset Volume
0x800.description: If the volume of the headset connected to your base Quick Disconnect (QD) is too low, select your headset model to increase the volume.

options.legacy: EncorePro 700 Series & All Other Headset Models

0x801.name: Tone Control
0x801.description: Boost your bass or treble tones to optimize your listening experience. You can customize desk phone and computer tones separately for each device.

0x802.name: Close Conversation Limiting
0x802.description: Limit the amount of nearby conversation transmitted through your microphone. (Note: changes will take effect on the next call.)

Sidetone.name: Sidetone
Sidetone.description: Adjust the volume of your voice that you hear when speaking.

0x804.name: ANC Timeout
0x804.description: Save battery life by reducing the amount of time Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) remains on when your headset is idle.

ANC Mode.name: ANC Mode
ANC Mode.description: Select the best noise cancelling level for your environment.

Notification Tones.name: Notification Tones
Notification Tones.description: Hear notification tones from other connected devices while streaming audio.

0x806.name: Independent Volume Control
0x806.description: Enable or Disable Independent volume control.

0x807.name: Daisy Chain Audio
0x807.description: Select the audio output you hear when speakerphones are daisy-chained together.

Equalizer.name: Equalizer
Equalizer.description: Set the Equalizer preset to your preferred sound signature.

Factory Reset.name: Factory Reset
Factory Reset.description: This action will reset all settings for your device to factory default.

true.title: Factory Reset
true.text: All your custom settings will be restored to their original defaults.

0x90C.name: Restart Device
0x90C.description: This action immediately restarts your device.

Clear Trusted Devices.name: Clear Trusted Devices
Clear Trusted Devices.description: Delete the list of connected devices stored on your headset. (This applies to all connected devices, including the BT700.)

true.title: Clear Trusted Devices
true.text: This action clears all connected devices stored on your headset, including the BT700 USB adapter.

0x900.name: Vibrate on Ring
0x900.description: Set your headset to vibrate when you receive incoming calls.

0x901.name: Charge Confirmation
0x901.description: Set your headset to vibrate to confirm that your headset is charging.

Online Indicator.name: Online Indicator
Online Indicator.description: Enable the LED indicator on your device to inform others that you are on a call.

0x903.name: Wearing Preference for Volume Control
0x903.description: Indicate headset wearing preference (left or right ear) and always puts volume control upwards to increase volume level.

0xA00.name: Audio Sensing
0xA00.description: Automatically establish a radio link between the base and your wireless headset when the USB port detects computer audio.

0xA01.name: Dialtone
0xA01.description: Hear a dialtone for a VoIP call when you press your headset's call button. Your softphone must support dialtones.

0xFFF1.name: Auto-Connect to Mobile Phone
0xFFF1.description: Automatically reconnect the Savi base to your paired mobile device when the phone comes within range of the base unit.

0xFFF2.name: Anti–Startle
0xFFF2.description: Algorithms that eliminate acoustic shock from loud sounds for your protection and listening comfort.

0x60E.name: Battery Status
0x60E.description: Hear your battery status when you power on your device.

Connection Indication.name: Connection Indication
Connection Indication.description: Hear a voice prompt indicating connection status.

0x80C.name: Bluetooth
0x80C.description: Enable or disable all Bluetooth connections on the Sync speaker.

-.name: Connection
-.description: Hear a voice prompt indicating connection status.

0x907.name: Bluetooth Secure Connection
0x907.description: Press the bluetooth pairing button to complete the connection between the speakerphone and mobile device.

Custom Button.name: Custom Button
Custom Button.description: Assign the action that launches when you tap the action button.

0x909.name: Exclusive Connection
0x909.description: Remove previous paired device information when a new device is paired and connected. This allows only one device to be paired and connected at a time.

0xC07.name: White Balance
0xC07.description: Specify how the camera compensates for variation in room light sources.

0xC09.name: Gain
0xC09.description: Adjust the signal amplification from the camera.

0xC0A.name: Pan
0xC0A.description: Adjust the left or right direction of the camera.

0xC0B.name: Tilt
0xC0B.description: Adjust the up or down direction of the camera.

0xC0C.name: Roll
0xC0C.description: Adjust the roll angle of the camera.

0xC11.name: Skin Enhancement
0xC11.description: Enables or disables natural skin color enhancements for participants.

0xC12.name: Wide Dynamic Range
0xC12.description: Enable or disable camera exposure based on the framed area instead of full view.

0xC13.name: Participant Count
0xC13.description: Report the participant count in meetings.

0xC14.name: On-Screen Display
0xC14.description: Display camera parameters on the video output.

0xC15.name: Acoustic Fence
0xC15.description: Enable Poly Acoustic Fence to block background noise and configure the width of the Poly Acoustic Fence beam.

0xC16.name: Poly NoiseBlockAI for Outgoing Audio
0xC16.description: Prevent distracting sounds in your environment (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from interrupting your meeting.

0xC24.name: Poly NoiseBlockAI for Incoming Audio
0xC24.description: Prevent distracting sounds from the far end of the conversation (like keyboard typing or paper shuffling) from interrupting your meeting.

0xC17.name: Stereo Audio
0xC17.description: Use two audio channels on the camera to provide stereo sound.

0xC18.name: Tracking Speed
0xC18.description: Configure how fast the camera detects meeting participants.

0xC19.name: Tracking Mode
0xC19.description: Configure how the camera tracks participants.

0xC21.name: Bass
0xC21.description: Adjust audio bass output from the speaker.

0xC22.name: Treble
0xC22.description: Adjust audio treble output from the speaker.

0xC23.name: Anti-Flicker (50Hz / 60Hz) Solution
0xC23.description: Select the appropriate frequency (NTSC 60Hz / PAL 50Hz) to reduce display flicker.

0xC25.name: Resolution
0xC25.description: Select the appropriate resolution for camera preview.

options.3: Flip and Mirror in both directions

0xC29.name: HDR
0xC29.note: To view HDR changes when camera is in use by another app, turn Camera Preview off and on in the app in use.

0xC1A.name: Frame Size
0xC1A.description: Configure the camera tracking framing view.

0xC1B.name: Maximum Zoom
0xC1B.description: Limit the maximum camera zoom in ratios of 2x, 3x, or 4x

Mute Reminder.name: Mute Reminder
Mute Reminder.description: Receive a helpful reminder that your headset is muted during a call. Configure how and when the reminder occurs.

0xC8D.name: App Button
0xC8D.description: Select the platform you want to access from your display.

0xC8E.name: Rocket Button
0xC8E.description: Assign the action that launches when you tap the rocket ship

0xC90.name: Display Brightness
0xC90.description: Adjust the brightness of your display.

0xC81.name: Display Contrast
0xC81.description: Adjust the contrast of your display.

0x910.name: PC Audio Persistence Mode
0x910.description: If enabled, the PC Audio will be mixed with deskphone interface.

Manage All.name: Manage All
Manage All.description: Select the prompts and tones you hear while using your device.

Calls.name: Calls
Calls.description: Hear voice prompts or tones to indicate call status.

Incoming Call.name: Incoming Call
Incoming Call.description: Hear a voice prompt when you receive an incoming call.

Active Audio Tone.name: Active Audio Tone
Active Audio Tone.description: Hear a short tone combination indicating that the audio channel is open and ready for communication.

Hold Reminder.name: Hold Reminder
Hold Reminder.description: Receive a helpful reminder that you have a call on hold.

Transparency Mode.name: Transparency Mode
Transparency Mode.description: Select the transparency mode level and sound signature.

Custom Swipe Sensor Idle.name: Idle
Custom Swipe Sensor Idle.description: Assign the quick action when the device goes into an idle state.

Custom Swipe Sensor In Call.name: In Call
Custom Swipe Sensor In Call.description: Assign the quick action for when in a call.

Custom Swipe Sensor Streaming Media.name: Streaming Media
Custom Swipe Sensor Streaming Media.description: Assign the quick action for when streaming media.

powerCycleRequiredDialog.powerOffText: Remember to power off your headset for at least 5 seconds for your new settings to take effect.

Language Selection.name: Select language
Language Selection.description: Select the language you would like to hear for all voice prompts and alerts (e.g. "Incoming call from John", "Mute on").

SELECT_LANGUAGE.TITLE: Select Language
SELECT_LANGUAGE.DESCRIPTION: Select the language you would like to hear for all voice prompts and alerts (e.g. “Incoming call from John”, “Mute on”).
SELECT_LANGUAGE.DESCRIPTION_USB_CABLE: To change the language you would like to hear for voice prompts and alerts, connect your {{device_name}} to your computer via USB cable.
SELECT_LANGUAGE.DESCRIPTION_CHARGE_CASE: Select the language you would like to read for the case's navigation, and hear in your earbuds.
SELECT_LANGUAGE.DESCRIPTION_CHARGE_CASE_USB_CABLE: Select the language you would like to read for the case's navigation, and hear in your earbuds, connect your {{device_name}} to your computer via USB cable.

GENERAL.LABEL: General
GENERAL.CAMERA_VIVID_NOTE: The device needs to be restarted in order to apply Camera Vivid mode.

BLUETOOTH.LABEL: Bluetooth
BLUETOOTH.REMOTE_CONTROL_CONNECTION_NOTE: You must pair the remote control manually after you disable and re-enable the connection.

CERTIFICATES.LABEL: Certificates
CERTIFICATES.VALIDATE_PEER_CERTS: Always validate peer certificates from server

IMPORT_EXPORT_CONFIG.TITLE: Configuration
IMPORT_EXPORT_CONFIG.DESCRIPTION: Export the configuration file to your local system, or import a configuration set from a local file. You must restart your device for an imported configuration to take effect.

LOGIN_WITH_DEVICE_PASSWORD.DESCRIPTION: If you don’t see the settings that you are looking for, please contact your Poly Lens  Administrator, or, login with the Device password.
LOGIN_WITH_DEVICE_PASSWORD.INVALID_PASSWORD: The password you entered is invalid. Please enter the password again.

ADMIN_PASSWORD.PASSWORD_UNMATCH: Passwords do not match. Please re-enter new password.
ADMIN_PASSWORD.SAME_PASSWORD_ERROR: You cannot use a password you have used before. Please enter a new password.

AUDIO_EQUALIZER.TITLE: Audio Equalizer
AUDIO_EQUALIZER.DESCRIPTION: Get and Set Bass and Treble sliders.

FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.EULA_DESCRIPTION: By clicking "I Accept" below, you acknowledge and agree that your use of this software is governed by the terms of the
FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.EULA_I_ACCEPT: I accept the End User License Agreement
FTC_PASSWORD_AND_EULA.PASSWORD_INVALID: The password you entered is invalid. Please enter the password again.

FTC_IDENTITY.DEVICE_NAME_DESCRIPTION: We recommend naming this device after the room or meeting space it is located in.
FTC_IDENTITY.PASSWORD_INVALID: The password you entered is invalid. Please enter the password again.

AUDIO_TEST.TITLE: Audio Test
AUDIO_TEST.DESCRIPTION: It takes several minutes to complete the audio test and download the audio records to your local disk. Click 'Start Test' for the system to record audio from all audio input ports: microphone, USB and line-in.
AUDIO_TEST.PLEASE_WAIT: Please wait while diagnostics are saved.

QUICK_DISCONNECT.TITLE: On Device Disconnect
QUICK_DISCONNECT.DESCRIPTION: Automatically apply the selected behavior when you disconnect your headset from the Poly in-line adapter.
QUICK_DISCONNECT.LOCK_SCREEN_AND_HOLD_CALL: Lock Computer Screen & Place Active Call on Hold

KEEP_LINK_UP.TITLE: Headset to PC Radio Link
KEEP_LINK_UP.DESCRIPTION: Keep the radio link to the PC active after the call ends.

login.TITLE: Your Account
login.DESCRIPTION_INTRO: You are not currently logged in. By logging in, you agree to our

startOnSystemStartup.TITLE: Launch Poly Lens on Startup
startOnSystemStartup.DESCRIPTION: Allow Poly Lens to start up automatically upon login.

Language.TITLE: Language
Language.LABEL: Select the language used in this application.

targetSoftphone.TITLE: Target Softphone
targetSoftphone.DESCRIPTION: Indicates the softphone that will be used for outgoing calls and dial tone (for supported devices and softphone).

mediaPlayerAction.TITLE: Media Player Action on Incoming Call
mediaPlayerAction.DESCRIPTION: Controls the behavior of media player applications, such as iTunes and Windows Media Player, when you receive a softphone call.

Notifications.TITLE: Notifications & Device Alerts
Notifications.DISCLAIMER: Your organization is managing some of your devices software update via Policy. Notifications for these devices will stay enabled.

enableNotifications.TITLE: Allow Desktop Notifications and Device Alerts

wellness.TITLE: Wellbeing
wellness.DESCRIPTION: Proper hydration and consistent movement are essential to your wellbeing in a primarily stationary environment. Select options to customize notification frequency and timing.

softwareUpdate.TITLE: Poly Lens Desktop Version
softwareUpdate.CONTINUE_DESC: Select {{open_tag}}Continue{{close_tag}} to exit Poly Lens and install the update.
softwareUpdate.DOWNLOAD_ERROR: There was an error downloading the update. Please check your internet connection and try again.
softwareUpdate.NOTIFICATION: Your organization requires the use of specific software version. Please update as soon as possible.

SUPPORT.DIAGNOSTICS_DESCRIPTION: For troubleshooting assistance, download logs to share with the Support team
